reviewText:
Early Access Review

While this game looks promising, I would suggest you  take a Wait and see attude about it.  I will give it a thumbs up but i want to make a few things clear.

1. When you buy a game to play on your own pc you should be able to play it your way. At this time the developers (or rather Single developer that made this). Has not taken this into consideration. If you play on a server with other people, the person running the server should set up the rules.

2. Everything is about choices.  Some of us do not have the weeks and weeks to gather resources to build everything.  That is why most games employ a creative mode.  The author of this game will not commit to this so I would suggest that you pass on this game  if you do not want to  spend the time on it .

3. The day / night cycle is too short (days are 12 minutes long and so are nights),You can not accomplish anything in that short amount of time. There is to much time spent on eating and drinking  and fighting off monsters you can not even see or hear at night until you are dead . And if you get caught in the spawn area with a zombie  you just die over and over and cant do anything about it.

4. If you Start a new player in a world you already created you get NOTHING (no tools or anything ). Good luck in chopping down a tree or anything,   You cant do anything


5.This game requires you to stand in front of an anvil while you are making plates and you cant move or do anything else , A steel plate takes over 30 seconds.  If you need a dozen,   well you get my point.

6. Food and water are spoiling too fast in your inventory ,  even if you build a freezer , they wont keep more then an hour or so. This needs to be rethought.

I think the game shows promise but as of now you might want to watch the updates and see what happens.

So now for the pros and cons.

Pros

1. great graphics
2. The ability to create many things.
3. Play with friends on a lan or over the internet.
4. Hundreds of things can be built.
5. The Sound is pretty good.

Cons
1. Zombies are too agressive. They Cant be seen or heard night or day.
2. Lack of a creative mode or way to turn off fighting if you want a peaceful mode.
3. Day night cycle is too short.
4. Working with the anvil is too time consuming
5. Resource regeneration is too slow.
6. Hunger and thirst go down to fast.
7. Creating a new player in a new world yields a blank inventory.
8. Walk speed is a bit to slow.
9. The game seems to generate a fairly small world even at its largest setting. Unless i am missing something the single landmass is the only landmass in the world.  (yes unity can create endless worlds if you program it to )
10. Food spoils at too fast a rate , even if you place it in a freezer.

Bottom line.

Like most early access games on steam this one is probably a little too early.  I have a feeling that in time  the game will be a fun and exciting addition to your  library .

According to the credits, the game states it was written by 1 person. It will probably take a long time before it is done. The price is right If you want to deal with all of the issues right now. I am sure they will improve.

I will update this review if things change.

I can´t wait for a multiplayer serverlist, this should be great fun in multiplayer, especially if the thing with the credits works because I can imagine some people will want to trade items and specialize production and maybe even make little shops to sell their products... a RP server for this game would be kinda epic... hope the devs stay with it because in the long run, this could become something special, it has that potential!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My life in Starsone

1. Look around wondering whats happening

2. Use my ice pick to chop wood

3. Made a workbench

4. Look for food

5. Went mining

6. Made furnaces and started making base

7. Started to make more advanced items

8. Sit there for around 3 or 2 hours wondering how to make stuff

9. Give up and look for guides

10. Found a good guide (Only Guide) and started constructing advanced items

11. Finds out about Aliens" (They look like zombies) and starts looking around

12. Finds also out that the Aliens are totally silent and they run really fast at night

13. Hide in house till day

14. go outside thinking its all good and safe

15. die in a few seconds because there were two Aliens next to my house

16. Returned to base and killed them

17. Made a Gun with some ammo

18. Shot the aliens dead

19. Makes High-Tech Bench

20. Celebrates

21. Finds out that it requires so much to make a Vehicle Factory

22. Sit there for around 4 hours collecting and waiting

23. Got both factorys

24. went outside to place them

25. got kill by aliens again

26. placed down the factorys

27. had a little cry because it costs so much to make a spaceship (I'm still making it)

28. decided to make the mobile base

29. finsihed the mobile base

30. celebrated by running over a bunch of aliens

31. head back to base and grab some items for the spaceship

32. as i reach base there is like 3 or 4 aliens sitting there

33. uses turrent and kills them

34. sitting in my base waiting for day and the resources to finish

35. head to my green house and grab some food

36. look out window and notices two aliens running stright at me

37. i ran up stairs and barricaded my self hoping that they can't destroy blocks

38. relise they cant destroy blocks and head down stairs

39. nearly makes spaceship (I still to get 400 conductors)

40. Decicided to blast down trees with turrent and deforest the whole island

41. got only around 300 rasin

42. waited and waited

43. decide to make more vehicles while waiting

44. makes the buggy and goes crazy

45. makes a huge factory with a fence and lights around it

46. forgets to close main door

47. boom power goes out no lights at al

48. ♥♥♥♥ my self when i start seeing figures head through the door

49. runs outside trying to get in the mobile base

50. gets attack by aliens

51. had a little rage cause they started camping the spawn

52. went crazy with the gun

53. notice i've played 11 hours in one day

54. gets tired and falls asleep

This is my adventure and i'm hoping this game will have tons more content :D

8/10"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A one man developer game, actually in alpha ( pre alpha state ) meaning that can be long before the game is completed. In the curent state its playable, keyboard can be configured. Graphics are good enough but nothing more. No story, only building blocks with few 'space alien zombies' and world generation is 3 kind of islands : small / normal / big. Ive played Feed the beast ( minecraft ) in the past and some machine craftings remembered me that. Geothermal generator, furnace, electrolyzer, crusher and more. Since there is no wiki at the moment I had to learn by myself and its not really complicated at all ( basic survival games ) except I encountered 2-3 things that I have no idea of the purpose. I paid 8,79 CND ( 20% off 10,99 CND) good price for a early acces, already 36 hours in it and cant wait to see more updates.

My FPS was 59-60 on a i7 3820 3.60 GHz / 16 Go ram / NVidia Geforce GTX 760

reviewText:
Early Access Review

* FIRST AND FOREMOST IMPORTANCE *

Majority of the player base for this game is Russian speaking.  I'd just like to warn you that if (like me) you don't speak a word of Russian, this game is not for you.  Don't believe me?  Look at the Pinned threads, then go through pages of conversation all in the Russian script and find out for yourself.  The developer himself is replying in russian on the thread questions and there doesn't seem to be any real english translations to guide us english speaking community to understand what is going on with the thread.  Considering this is a Pinned thread, this enforces my statement further.  If I'd known I was going to buy a game that was not going to at least balance out the english language and give some of us an insight of wha'ts gonig on and being said, I would have swerved past this product.  As it is, I'm now stuck with it.

I've given this game a fair 30+ hours of playtime so I should be able to make a relatively good base of a review on it.

First and foremost, its not a bad game .  Don't let the Thumbs down actually deter people from actually purchasing the game.  I've done literally everything you can in game in regards to building what's currently available across two single player servers.


The Pro's of the game

* At the start, it is relatively slow to get yourself on your feet.  It took me around 2 realtime days to actually get some sort of broken battery power initiated to actually make any real progress.  Once you get a thermal generator up its smooth sailing for the most part.

* You can make a fair few nice designs for base building.  The map can be varied to small, medium and big so you can get a lot of room to go places or keep the area small and managable.

* The cross-server option is nice.  You make a fake world to mine resources and clear-cut the map to then bring over to your homeworld map (like Savage Lands where you can make a resource map - delete when cleared).

* I do see a lot of potential if the game continues to go in this developing direction.

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Now the Cons - and sadly there's a lot more in these than the Pro's
----------------------------------------------------------------------

* Firstly, having aliens popping up ONLY at night (nearly always three and they randomly spawn whever they like) and die in three hits are tedious.  Technically any sort of barrier or even uneven surface they get stuck on and run at you where you can easily just kill them off.  They need a huge improvement with AI and spawning options.

* A lot of the things you can build need to actually be operational and useful.   Currently, things like the Greenhouse, Filler and one or two other items constructed serve utterly no purpose.  They have not been scripted and are currently a construction waste of time as they do absolutely nothing at all.    These need to serve some sort of purpose.

* My biggest headache - and a lot of the community agree - is that there is absolutely NO tooltips on items to be constructed.  I understand what machine (for example) does what by building and use it. (or I've had to refer to the discussions thread with other people asking those same questions).  The items are listed, it tells you what materials are needed to craft, however there's no description AT ALL as to what their purpose is.

* The food side of things.  I am so fed up with just banana trees, oranges and lemons.  That's all I've found on EVERY world I've created and I've make hundreds of servers with different ratios for the resources sides.  but things like the Apple Trees, vegetables of ANY sort, etc etc... none of them exist.  I've never found any at all and really, I've solely been relying on oranges for the most part as a food source.  They decay in hand way too fast and the Freezer only slows it, so there's no real storage to keep them fresh.

* Stuff needs to be described in regards to placement of structures.  I slapped down about 1500 blocks to be able to place the air transport factory as when I tried to place it on the map as its partially hilly, half of it was in a mountain or half underwater so I made a platform large enough (as its f'cking huge!) to place it on.  Total waste of time as it did not place on a flat structure.  This needs to be a possible option.  The Transport Factory has no problem being on a platform so why one and not the other?

* Stuff like fishing, hunting that sort of thing would be good in game.  However, its currently not.. its a 3x tree farming simulator.

* Some items are categorically useless.  The campfire purifies water 1x2 for the bottles.  When you upgrade to a Distiller, its 1x1, the process is a little slower, but you don't lose one bottle to every two.   Then there's the Chem Lab.  All its DOES is purify water and that's pretty much it.  Its the fastest of the three but what's the point of the middle man really?

* Lastly, one other thing that has me a little concerned regarding the game that I read on Forum, I was trying to figure out the use of the Filler machine.  I have a vague idea but as its not doing what its supposed to do, I can't do anything with it.  I'm certain though that someone asked a question in regard to the Filler and the developer responded something like What is a Filler?"
This actually concerns me as he was the one who put the object in and he himself doesn't know?   Two thirds of the forums are literally nothing but conversations in Russian which makes us english speaking only population at a loss unless we get a broken google translation decipher.   So it does raise my concerns regarding how "user friendly" its going to be.

Please note
date: the main picture is of Space.  So Far I've found nothing that leads me into space and I'm not even certain if the games even developed that far.  The main picture on the Store page with the picture of Jupiter and one of its four main moons Europa.. that's the night sky spashscreen you see every night on your little chunk of island.  The bigger map may have fragments off shore
recommended: but it looks like there's no other islands off where you start.  I swam/walked for a solid 2 hours and saw nothing but ocean.  So I'm assuming its only the land you start on being the map itself.\nPersonally I would wait to see how the game develops.  Its been enjoyable so far just to build bases and try and get some sort of power grid going.  Other than that
hoursPlayed: there's really nothing else to do.  So I'd suggest holding your money until it develops further."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Collect and craft game in the online mutliplayer style.
Same as always? Possible not, StarsOne seems to be a attempting to differentiate itself from its competitors by the range of building and progression through the crafting and if you see the screenshots you can see how advance you can go, but you do start of with building with wood and basic iron always up to modern electric items.

Graphics of the game are competent nothing that is world changing but its good enough (without floating items you seem to get in random generate worlds). Only one area that needs work is shadowing on landscapes which especially one land seem to flick in and out of existence.

Survival part of the game you need to keep health, hunger and thirst under wraps. The game has gone for a seed system for food, so as soon as you find one piece of fruit you can make trees to make more and more and more meaning this aspect of the game looks after itself. Water side of the game I had to deal with be building my base next to water and making bottles is very cheap and easy so you can care plenty of water around with you again not adding torment to the game which is not bad as the game seems to centre around crafting more then the survival.

So why you not recommending?
The core game play loop for me is just plain boring. I found very little need to go explore other then to find more ore for mining which seems to be about the only thing you cannot just keep building more off. The ore is just in the middle of fields you run up to it and hit it, I feel a sense of exploring to find items would help a sense of achievement to the game for me to keep me interested.
It takes so long to turn ore to ingot (which can be left to do on its own) also even longer to use an anvil and turn ingot into usable parts all of which you just have to twiddle your thumbs.

Can multi-player save the game?
In its current state No, but I feel its the area that could save" this game but the interaction between characters need to be made to offer great variety and allow people to build a world which they can almost rule
date:
adding the human character aspects between players.

If you just love collect and craft games give it a go for early access its better then most. Has the game done enough to separate itself from the market? If you just like simple building game then yes but for survival games it lacks compare to other choices.
https://youtu.be/oqoDwOdFzI8
"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

With almost twelve hours into this game, I've built almost everything that is currently available, and have even tried my hand at finding bugs. This game is very stable, and very straight foreward for something this early in development. I cannot wait to see what they add in the future, especially with the mention of trading, colonizing, and space travel in general.

Full discloser though, I did spend about a quarter of my time so far just playing with the digger. So.....nine hours of good gameplay if you really want to rush things.

If they continue to add to this game, and maybe make the guides and discussion threads a little easier to access for english speakers, this will be amazing, and you will be happy you spend ten dollars on it. But even if they don't, it's ten dollars for an actual working game, unlike other early access titles(It's less buggy than some AAA games at launch, and it's still VERY early access. That is a good sign.)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Early Early Alpha...while I don't disagree that the game has potential, you would be best served to wait until some basic, core functionality has been bug-fixed.

Developers, it's a game-breaking bug when playing with a friend if you can't craft at the same time. As it stands, if you are crafting in any device, be it an anvil or whatever, and your friend is doing the same, you will take their items from what they are doing. So if they are hammering out steel plates, their steel ingots will magically appear in your inventory and out of their anvil.

reviewText:

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIm impressed! hasn't been out long but its actually well thought out. Has some bugs as all early access does  but im having a blast so far. took me a while to realise the dirty water was what was killing me but i eventually got it. Got really excited the first time i got to shoot an alien with my assault riffle. I recomend this for any survivalist gamer.

Star One just revitalized my love for survival and craft games, this game has a lot of potential, and as I saw Rust turn what is now I would like to see this game grow too!

10/10

PS: Dev,  please introduce some descriptions and more information for the ingame objects.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

At this time day and night are to short or at lest day.you get hunger and need water way to fast.
rember it is still in the making.the game has high hope there's already lots of crafting and base building is easy to use it is also a pretty game to play. nice sunrises and at night 2 large moons to looks at so far my incounters with mobs have been easy to kill one or two hits with the sword and there dead.the top trier crafting seem a bet trying takes awhile to greater and brake it all down into what  you need But not to very bad... if you likie survial and crafting you well like this one. A+
